gurmukhi: ਘੋਰਿ ਘੋਰਿ ਦਸੋ ਦਿਸਾ ਨਹਿ ਸੂਰਬੀਰ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਥ ॥ ਅਾੲਿਕੈ ਜੂਝੇ ਸਭੈ ਰਣ ਰਾਮ ੲੇਕਲ ਸਾਥ ॥੬੮॥
transliteration: Gher(i) Gher(i) Daso Disaa Nah(i) Soorbeer Pramaath|| Aaekai Joojhe Sabhai Ran Raam Ekal Saath||68||
translation: From all the ten directions, the demon warriors rushed forth for fighting only with Ram.68.

gurmukhi: ਰਣੰ ਪੇਖ ਰਾਮੰ ॥ ਧੁਜੰ ਧਰਮ ਧਾਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Ranan Pekh Raamannd|| Dhujan Dharam Dhaamannd||
translation: Seeing Ram, the Dharma-incarnate, in the battlefield and uttering various shouts from their mouth,

gurmukhi: ਚਹੂੰ ਓਰ ਢੂਕੇ ॥ ਮੁਖੰ ਮਾਰ ਕੂਕੇ ॥੬੯॥
translation: The demons rushed forth all the four directions and gathered together.69.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਘੋਰ ਬਾਜੇ ॥ ਧੁਣੰ ਮੇਘ ਲਾਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Bade Ghor Baaje|| Dhounan Megh Laaje||
translation: The musical instruments resounded violently and hearing their sounds, he clouds felt shy.

gurmukhi: ਝੰਡਾ ਗੱਡ ਗਾੜੇ ॥ ਮੰਡੇ ਬੈਰ ਬਾੜੇ ॥੭੦॥
transliteration: Jhandaa Gadd Gadde|| Mande Bair Baade||70||
translation: Fixing their banners on the earth; the demons, filled with enmity began to wage war.70.
The bows clattered and the swords struck.

gurmukhi: ਢਲਾ ਢੁੱਕ ਢਾਲੈ ॥ ਚਲੀ ਪੀਤ ਪਾਲੈ ॥੭੧॥
translation: There was great knocking on the shields and the swords falling on them performed the rite of love.71.

gurmukhi: ਰਣੰ ਰੰਗ ਰੱਤੇ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਮੱਲ ਮੱਤੇ ॥
transliteration: Ranan Ran Ratte|| Mano Mall Matte||
translation: All the warriors were absorbed in the war so much like the werestlers in th wrestling arena.
The arrows were showered and there was the crackling of the bows.72.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਬਾਨ ਬਰਖਾ ॥ ਸੁਣੇ ਜੀਤ ਕਰਖਾ ॥
translation: Wishing for their victory, the demons showered their arrows.
Sabahu and Marich, knocking their teeth in fury, marched forward.73.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੈ ਬਾਰ ਟੂਟੇ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਬਾਜ ਛੂਟੇ ॥
transliteration: Ikai Baar Toote|| Mano Baaj Chhodhte||
translation: Both of them together pounced upon like a falcon, and,

gurmukhi: ਲਯੋ ਘੋਰਿ ਰਾਮੰ ॥ ਸਸੰ ਜੇਮ ਕਾਮੰ ॥੭੪॥
transliteration: Layo Gher(i) Raamannd|| Sasan Jem Kaamannd||74||
translation: They surrounded ram like the Cupid (Kamdev), surrounding the moon.74.
